intro: Colea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy colea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Colea hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
